title: Man rushes to aid his nephew and his pregnant girlfriend and shoots dead a 17-year-old mugger
text:
A father-of-five rushed to the aid of his nephew and his nephew’s pregnant girlfriend during a robbery attempt and shot dead a teenage suspect in Argentina last week.

A home surveillance camera in the city of Longchamps captured the shocking moment when a group of three muggers fired at Claudio Ramón Pardo's nephew, Ezequiel, 27, and his nephew’s pregnant girlfriend on Thursday morning.

After Ezequiel tossed his car keys and a cellphone over the gate to his assailants, his 46-year-old uncle stepped out of a second-floor door and started firing at the suspects with his handgun.

Claudio Ramón Pardo came to the aid of his nephew and his pregnant girlfriend when three muggers attempted to mug them outside the family home in Longchamps, Argentina

Surveillance camera captures the moment one of the three suspects fires at a 27-year-old man and his pregnant girlfriend in Argentina before his uncle killed a 17-year-old suspect and wounded his 18-year-old accomplice.The suspects are pictured above

Ezequiel (left) gave up his car keys and cell phone to the shooter (right) before his uncle came to his defense and shot two of the robbery suspects

The thugs attempted to escape in Ezequiel's vehicle failed to get the engine running.

The suspects then ran off before Pardo struck two of them, killing a 17-year-old boy, whose name was not released by the police.

Pardo also wounded 18-year-old Patricio González in the leg. He was arrested and taken to a local hospital.

A third accomplice fled the scene.

Claudio Ramón Pardo unloads his weapon at three robbery suspects, who attempted to flee with his nephew's car, and killed a 17-year-old boy. Authorities cleared Pardo of any wrongdoing

A 17-year-old robbery suspect was killed by a home owner in Argentina last Thursday

According to Argentine outlet Clarin, the police believe the gun used in the attempted robbery was taken from the crime scene by the third suspect, who remains at-large.

Investigators found a paycheck in a backpack that was secured at the scene and traced it to a woman who had been mugged by the group earlier that morning.

Pardo was taken into custody but released a couple of hours later after a prosecutor said the man 'acted in self-defense.'
description: Claudio Ramón Pardo shot at three robbery suspects, killing one, outside his residence in Longchamps, Argentina, last Thursday. He was cleared of any wrongdoing.
